main event: A silvery, disc-like, circular object hovered in the sky over Benson, Arizona for 52 minutes on April 3, 1952.
interesting points: The object did not move during the 52 minute observation period.
Two Air Force pilots and several other people observed the object from the Benson airport.
One of the pilots flew a T-6 aircraft up to 12,500 feet to try and get a better view of the object, but there was no definitive change in its size or appearance.
Several cadets flying T-6 aircraft in the area also observed the object.
The manner in which the object disappeared is uncertain, as one of the observers lost sight of it for about 15 seconds before it was gone.
witnesses: Air Force pilots, cadets, and other people at the Benson airport
